*Met Council is America’s largest Jewish charity dedicated to serving the needy. * Minimum of 1 year supervisory experience

title: UX Strategist and UI Designer
description:
**New York Film Academy, New York**


New York Film Academy is committed to an inclusive work culture where people's thoughts, ideas, concerns, and cultures are valued and respected. We welcome applicants with diverse backgrounds and those sharing in our commitment to inclusivity.

**POSITION SUMMARY:**


The UX Strategist and UI Designer is responsible for the user experience (UX), user interface (UI) design, functionality, content, and customer journey of the NYFA website; digital and UI design for marketing and advertising efforts; layout and coordination of enrollment marketing emails and landing pages; and general marketing support for enrollment-focused strategies and advertising efforts in multiple mediums (digital, web, video, social media, interactive, event, etc).


This role will primarily lead efforts to ensure that NYFA websites are current, easy to navigate, and optimized for the journey of multiple audiences with an emphasis on UX, UI design, customer/ student journey of the NYFA websites (nyfa.edu, hub.nyfa.edu), clear content and content coordination, and other UX-driven marketing and enrollment-focused strategies and media. This role is hands-on and will manage the day-to-day of website UX and updates, with a consideration for usability, SEO, clear content and visuals, and will make recommendations for user improvements that support enrollment. This position will also design and develop media for recruitment and marketing opportunities including emails, landing pages, digital ads, digital marketing outreach efforts, video ads and basic video editing, college guides, etc. This role will collaborate on cross-media efforts with other marketing channels including social media, advertising, PR, content, enrollment, print design, and web, and the broader NYFA community including faculty, students, and staff.


Enrollment marketing experience and prior experience working in web and marketing for Higher Education is preferred.

 **The UX Strategist and UI Designer position is a full-time role within the Marketing Department on the New York City campus. This is a hybrid role with the requirement to be in-person on campus 1-2 days a week to capture content and collaborate with teammates.**

 **Additional in-person days may be expected based on the schedule of events and activities (with advanced notice). This position reports to the Senior Director of Marketing.**

**REPRESENTATIVE RESPONSIBILITIES:**

*The following responsibilities are general duties that a particular employee in this position is expected to be able to perform. The day-to-day duties required of this position may vary.*

* Develop and refine UX strategies that align with organizational goals and user needs. Design interactions that enhance user engagement and improve overall user satisfaction.
* Own the day-to-day oversight of website UX and UI design through hands-on website editing in WordPress (or similar), including layout, functionality, content flow, user interface, page elements & order, and all aspects related to User Experience and customer journey.
* Regularly audit and review the website to make recommendations on improving user experience, content, navigation, and other aspects to support all NYFA goals, especially enrollment goals. Manage design and UX development from strategy through to website production.
* Solid understanding of people-centered user experience and interaction patterns. Ability to apply analytical thinking about customer journeys and content flows to the website, email communication sequences, and marketing content - specifically, have a deep understanding of the Higher Ed prospective student journey and how to develop communication and content to engage with this audience from interest through to enrollment.
* Oversight and creation of email marketing campaigns including layout design, strategy, email list logic and preparation of email lists through relevant audience segmentation, production, and deployment of emails (currently through Pardot / Salesforce), and adhere to an email sequence calendar that aligns with the enrollment cycle. Create drip campaigns and multi email sequence campaigns to engage various target audiences. Review email data to make recommendations for improvements.
* Create digital ads, video ads, social media ads, email headers, and other digital marketing campaigns and assets, as needed.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate user experience design principles into all project development phases. Regularly collaborate with Web and Marketing staff to ensure all aspects of the website, landing pages, digital ads, blog, emails, apps, and other promotional materials are providing the best user experience and clear messaging for prospective students, and all audiences. Strategically create new media to attract and incentivize new users, audiences, and students.
* Develop mockups, UX and creative direction, and recommendations for the web and marketing teams for the website, landing pages, emails, apps, and digital marketing based on UX best practices.
* Support and improve SEO performance through UX principles, including using tools and reporting from Google Analytics and/or SemRush, coordinating with Marketing team and SEO consultants; and making recommendations for improvements.
* Collaborate on new and creative marketing strategies and ideas to address business goals and meet consumer needs, at times leading execution with others to deliver on initiatives.

* Multi-task to complete assignments under deadline, and make quick turnarounds on projects. Be able to independently prioritize projects and meet deadlines.

title: Futures Electronic Execution Product Manager
description:
In recent years, Citi has greatly extended its capabilities in electronic trading, developing a suite of specialised futures algorithmic execution strategies, and increasing its global market footprint. The broader electronic team is comprised of experts with a particular focus on algorithms and analytics, data analysis and content, electronic sales-trading, EMS integration.


While our client coverage personnel primarily manage client relationships, this product role is expected to be client facing - speaking and presenting directly to “low touch” institutional clients as and when needed, marketing the product, and solving client issues. While global futures are a major component, note that the role spans listed derivatives more broadly, including all non-US equity options and global options on futures.


If you are interested in a role that uses your product expertise to help conceptualise thought process and design and optimize algorithm performance and design, then this role will be if interest. You will be expected to proactively follow market, industry, and client trends in your field of expertise, and adapt these for application on Citi’s products and solutions platforms.

**What you will do will be varied day to day, but the key drivers for the role are**:

* Algorithm design and optimizing algorithmic performance.
* Transaction Cost Analysis, for reviewing algo performance and using this to drive the product roadmap as well as client facing analytics.
* Managing both internal technology teams and vendors to ensure a timely and effective delivery of projects and initiatives.
* Internal education for new product launches –the global electronic team, high touch sales-traders, house traders, and external client marketing
* Working with clients on short term quantitative analysis and projects
* Management of our control’s environment – working with compliance and Electronic Trading risk managers to design appropriate controls that protect the firm but do not hinder genuine trading objectives.
* Internal advocate for electronic trading across multiple asset classes – working on joint projects with Cash Equities, Rates, FX, and Commodities
* Tracking success of the product and helping to influence our strategic direction.

**What we will need from you:**


This role requires a hands-on person who has a broad set of skills –both generalist knowledge and specialist. To be successful, the candidate must join the dots across multiple projects and business areas and have the credibility to drive and enthuse the team around them. Key attributes that will drive our selection include:

* Experience in listed derivatives markets – not necessarily direct trading experience (although that is helpful), but crucially, an understanding of market structure and microstructure, and the nuances of derivatives.
* Experience with algorithmic execution, Trading Analytics (TCA) and exchanges, OMS/EMS vendors, FIX protocol.
* Basic analytical and maths skills – ideally familiar with python charting and analytics libraries, drawing insights from data via traditional and ML techniques.
* Data architecture and coding best practices – there is no software development in this role, but the candidate would deal with software developers and can challenge poor design decisions.
* Ability to review complex systems and risk platforms, and spot where there could be technical issues; edge cases with algo behaviour, or gaps in protective controls.
* Confidence in talking to clients to market our offering, with fluent domain expertise.

* Understanding of regulation in different jurisdictions and how to adhere to regulatory rules and internal policies.

Our Operations groups are core to the success of the Markets business and have significant impact across the lifecycle of a trade. We partner extensively with a range of internal stakeholders including Front Office Sales and Trading Desks, Compliance, Legal, Finance and HR; alongside having significant interaction with our external client base, playing a key role in the overall client experience. We have a Client relationship group, dedicated to overseeing the Organizational service performance and strategic partnership for our top tier client base, where we play a key role in supporting our global clients to ensure they have a first-class experience when doing business with Citi.


Our Business Intelligence and Process Re-engineering group works alongside our Operations teams delivering automation solutions to solve for operational challenges. We partner with Citi’s innovation labs to drive optimization, and overall play a pivotal role in enabling us to transform to achieve our target operating model.


Our Technology partners develop and implement a wide range of applications that support the Operations, Change, Design and Implementation groups in providing innovative products and solutions. We have re-imagined how to provide technology and service in our domain through the alignment of our team vision, culture, and aggressive retirement plan for legacy applications and adoption of a micro-based containerized cloud environment. We encourage our people to create, explore and be adventurous whilst taking measured risk, adopting safe practices to protect the firm. Data lineage and optimization is core to how we develop our eco system. We are growing our capabilities using artificial intelligence, natural language processing and machine learning.


Our roles entail ensuring we operate in a robust control environment, whilst in a fast-paced workplace. We comply with global regulations and internal policies and adopt a proactive approach to identifying opportunities to reduce risk through the continuous evaluation of our controls; to protect our clients, the firm, and our reputation.

title: VP of Programs
description:

The Vice President of Programs will have overall strategic and operational responsibility for all program areas. The position will be a part of the senior management team that drives the overall strategy for the organization and represents the organization on a local and regional basis. The incumbent will initially develop deep knowledge of each program and their day-to-day operations and the organization’s business plan, while focusing on the following areas: program leadership and management, external relationships, and knowledge management.

  

The Vice President of Programs will also provide leadership, direction, and management to ensure compliance with all legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements. Provides direction, training, development, and leadership to all direct reports to ensure program services and teams are operating at the most optimal level to sustain and support the vision and mission of the organization by achieving organizational goals.

 **Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

**Organizational Development:**

* Develop the necessary systems, processes, and tools to better support the facilitation, collection, and sharing of knowledge that is generated by the programs.
* Develop dissemination system to share organizational learning with a broad range of communities.
* Ensure that key project outcomes and/or policy, advocacy, and regulation are evaluated and leveraged for maximum community and organizational impact.
* Work collaboratively with the senior management team to integrate cross program activities and functions.
* Strategically collaborate on the development of new programs and business initiatives.
* Implement measures to ensure that internal controls are in place, enforced, and reviewed periodically for conformance to contractual, organizational, and regulatory standards.
* Proactively initiate, revise, develop, implement, explain to ensure understanding of, and enforce current and new policies and procedures.
* Conduct ad-hoc reporting and analysis.

 **Program Management, Metrics, and Performance:**

* Ensure ongoing programmatic excellence by developing and operationalized strategies that leads programs and the organization to the next stage of growth.
* Oversees program management by leading the Assistant Vice Presidents in developing strategies, which ensure programs are delivering quality services and are meeting contractual requirements, including but not limited to, facility operations and regulatory compliance with ECB, DOB, FDNY.
* Certify annual program goals and targets support the mission and vision of the organization are met by monitoring program performance and developing strategies to ensure achievement.
* Ensure direct reports’ programs are meeting or exceeding governmental contractual and organizational performance metrics.

 **Financial Management:**

* Demonstrate consistent quality of finance and administration, fundraising, communications and systems; recommend timelines and resources needed to achieve the program goals.
* Support existing programs and the growth the organization by cultivating existing relationships and promoting the Development team’s initiatives with obtaining new funder relationships that will expand revenue generating and fundraising opportunities.
* Ensure programs are functioning within the approved operating budgets at a 95% capacity while prioritizing budgetary needs.

 **Continuous Quality Improvement (CQI):**

* Ensure direct reports develop processes and monitoring tools to meet or exceed governmental/funder and organizational compliance standards.
* Certify that trends are identified and addressed to aid in the improvement of program and organizational performance.
* Collaborate with the Director of CQI (Continuous Quality Improvement) on championing program continuous quality improvement, compliance and auditing processes, and training curriculums.
* Oversee governmental [local, state and federal] and internal audits and the development and enforcement of corrective action plans.

* Attract, develop, coach, and retain high-performance team members by direct interaction and supervision to motivate, empower and mentor them to elevate their level of responsibility, span of control, and performance.

* Provide leadership in development of inter-team communication and cohesiveness, sustaining culture and supporting staff during organizational growth.
* Promotes collaboration and effective communication amongst direct reports and between programs and business lines to achieve organizational and programmatic goals.

 **Secondary Responsibilities:**

* Facilitates effective communication with other staff within the interdisciplinary context, participates as an active member of the Homeless Services Senior Team and contributes to staff meetings.
* Ensures direct reports are implementing *good neighbor* policies within their local communities.
* Liaise with OTDA & DHS with respect to regulatory and contractual requirements.
* Represent the organization at external meetings with governmental agencies, community and organizational stakeholders.

* Problem solving responsibility: Exercise a high level of creativity and the ability to think analytically to effectively problem solve with limited information at hand.
* Working relationships and contacts: Foster positive relationships with internal contacts which will include interaction with senior leaders, management, employees within other departments, and direct reports. Will have contact with current and potential business partners.

Our pharmacy technician positions have undergone an exciting transformation, moving from a transaction-based environment to a much more patient-centric one.
